paper: Quadratic Direct Forecast for Training Multi-Step Time-Series Forecast Models

differences.summary: Missing log|Σ| term; surrogate not full NLL
differences.why_impacts_score: undermines correctness of likelihood grounding and stability of Σ optimization

evidence.baseline_quote: The quadratic objective follows directly from Gaussian NLL (Theorem 3.1; Eq. (2)).
evidence.final_quote: outer objective and updates use L_Σ without log|Σ|.

differences.summary: Method–experiment training objective mismatch (L_Σ vs MSE)
differences.why_impacts_score: creates confusion about method and undermines attribution of improvements

evidence.baseline_quote: QDF trains models using the learned Σ (Algorithm 2; Section 3.3).
evidence.final_quote: We train all models to minimize MSE on the training set (Section 4.1).

differences.summary: Reporting inconsistencies and questionable splits (PEMS averaging, Koopman, small test set)
differences.why_impacts_score: reduces reliability and fairness of benchmark comparisons

evidence.baseline_quote: Table 1’s SOTA claim is not a fully apples-to-apples comparison.
evidence.final_quote: PEMS uses horizons {12,24,36,48}; mismatch not clarified for PEMS rows.

differences.summary: PD vs PSD inconsistency for Σ constraint and inversion
differences.why_impacts_score: signals conceptual inconsistency affecting validity of Σ−1 use

evidence.baseline_quote: Cholesky to enforce Σ ⪰ 0 addresses a key constraint.
evidence.final_quote: constraint 'Σ ⪰ 0' plus Cholesky implies PD; PD vs PSD inconsistency not clarified.

differences.summary: Final explicitly cites methodological inconsistencies to justify lower scores
differences.why_impacts_score: explicit reason for lowering overall and technical quality scores

evidence.baseline_quote: Overall (10): 7 — Strong empirical results... but limited theoretical guarantees and some methodological ambiguities.
evidence.final_quote: Overall (10): 6 — key methodological inconsistencies... materially affect correctness and clarity.
